content: base of chain 3 *1 double_crochet in each of next 5 double_crochet 2 double_crochet in next double_crochet* repeat from * around to start join with a slip_stitch in top of chain 3 rnds 8-9 chain 3 1 double_crochet in each double_crochet around join with a slip_stitch in top of chain 3 round 10 chain 3 1 double_crochet decrease *make 26 double_crochet then decrease* repeat from * around to start join with a slip_stitch in top of chain 3 rnds 11-14 chain 3 1 double_crochet in each double_crochet around join with a slip_stitch in top of chain 3 rnds 15-18 chain 3 using the sari ribbon make 1 double_crochet in each double_crochet around join with a slip_stitch in top of chain 3 note the sari should be put on the hk before the very first yo for each double_crochet when pulling the yarn through the last 2 loops of each double_crochet the ribbon will be between these loops carefully pull the yo loop through the first loop then the ribbon and finally the last loop the ribbon should also be included in each starting chain 3 round 19 chain 3 decrease *make 27 double_crochet then decrease* repeat from * once double_crochet to end of round join with a slip_stitch in top of chain 3 rnds 20-22 chain 3 1 double_crochet in each double_crochet around join with a slip_stitch in top of chain 3 round 23 chain 3 decrease *form 20 double_crochet then decrease* repeat from * twice more double_crochet to end of round join with a slip_stitch in top of chain 3 rnds 24-26 chain 3 1 double_crochet in each double_crochet around join with a slip_stitch in top of chain 3 round 27 chain 3 1 double_crochet chain 1 *skip next double_crochet 1 double_crochet in next double_crochet after that chain 1* repeat from * to end of round join with a slip_stitch in top of chain 3 round 28 chain 3 double_crochet in each double_crochet and chain 1 space around to start join with a slip_stitch in top of chain 3 round 29 chain 3 1 double_crochet in each double_crochet around to start join with a slip_stitch in top of chain 3 bind off design by shannon johnson 2008 handle using the larger hk loosely chain 160 slip_stitch in 2nd chain from hk and in each chain across finishing weave in all ends place bag and handle in washing machine during the agitation cycle only check the progress of the felting periodically and end when desired amount has been achieved if the bag has not felted enough at the end of the agitation cycle then restart the machine and run another agitation cycle it is better not to run a full cycle of the machine at this point as certain cycles such as the spin cycle can damage the felted item when felting has finished gently ring out excess water by hand and move to dryer on a gentle/low heat cycle pull the bag and handle out when they are both
